response_parsed.title: Securing CLI Tools Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to secure command-line interface (CLI) tools using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is not limited to web applications; it can also be used to create secure CLI tools.
FastAPI provides built-in features like OpenAPI documentation, automatic validation of incoming requests, and more.
Using FastAPI for CLI tools allows us to take advantage of its security benefits without the overhead of a full-fledged web application.
To use FastAPI for CLI tools, we can utilize the `uvicorn.run` function with a custom FastAPI instance and CLI arguments.

code_examples.code:
import argparse
parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Secure CLI tool with FastAPI')
args = parser.parse_args()
uvicorn.run('main:app', host='localhost', port=8000, args=[f'--host={args.host}', f'--port={args.port}'])

version_notes: This example uses FastAPI version 0.69.0 and Python 3.12.2.
Ensure you have these versions installed or update the code according to your environment.
caveats: FastAPI is primarily a web framework, so while it can be used for CLI tools, it may not be the best choice if your goal is to create a standalone command-line application.
This example demonstrates a simple CLI tool; real-world applications will likely require additional features and customization.
